dataset.title: The Bear Brook Watershed in Maine, USA: Long-term stream chemistry 1986 - 2016

creator.organizationName: University of Maine; Appalachian Mountain Club

abstract.para: This dataset includes stream chemistry for the Bear Brook Watershed in Maine (BBWM). The BBWM consists of two watersheds, the reference East Bear (EB), receiving ambient deposition, and the treated West Bear (WB), which received experimental elevated N+S deposition for 27 years. Stream samples were collected as grab samples and event samples (e.g. during snowmelt and rain events) using ISCOâ„¢ automated samplers from both EB and WB streams. Stream chemistry was interpolated between collections to develop annual or monthly stream water fluxes.

intellectualRights.para: This information is released under the Creative Commons license - Attribution - CC BY (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). The consumer of these data (\"Data User\" herein) is required to cite it appropriately in any publication that results from its use. The Data User should realize that these data may be actively used by others for ongoing research and that coordination may be necessary to prevent duplicate publication. The Data User is urged to contact the authors of these data if any questions about methodology or results occur. Where appropriate, the Data User is encouraged to consider collaboration or co-authorship with the authors. The Data User should realize that misinterpretation of data may occur if used out of context of the original study. While substantial efforts are made to ensure the accuracy of data and associated documentation, complete accuracy of data sets cannot be guaranteed. All data are made available \"as is.\" The Data User should be aware, however, that data are updated periodically and it is the responsibility of the Data User to check for new versions of the data. The data authors and the repository where these data were obtained shall not be liable for damages resulting from any use or misinterpretation of the data. Thank you.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: BBWM is located in eastern Maine, USA at an elevation of 450.8 m. Soils are coarse-loamy, mixed, frigid Typic and Aquic Haplorthods. Bedrock consists dominantly of quartzite, phyllite, and calc-silicate low-grade metasediments, and minor granite dikes. The lower elevations are dominated by hardwood stands, and the upper elevations are dominated by softwood stands. The site is located in the Acadian Plains and Hills (82) Level III Ecoregion (Omernik et al. https://www.epa.gov/eco-research/ecoregions).

description.para: Detailed collection and analysis methods can be found in Norton et al 1999 (doi: 10.1023/A:1006115011381) and Navratil et al. 2010 (doi: 10.1007/s10661-010-1527-z).

dataTable.entityName: Stream concentration data for all samples collected
dataTable.entityDescription: Bear Brook watershed stream concentration data for all samples collected

attribute.attributeDefinition: seasons, determined on a three-month basis
If flagged with '< DL' then data are below the detection limit (0.5 ueq/L). If flagged with '< RL' then data are below the reporting limit (2.5 ueq/L) and should be used with caution.

textDomain.definition: If flagged with '< DL' then data are below the detection limit (0.5 ueq/L). If flagged with '< RL' then data are below the reporting limit (2.5 ueq/L) and should be used with caution.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Calcium, determined by: - Atomic Absorption Spectrophotometry (AAS) with N2O-acetylene flame (1998 and prior) - Inductively Coupled Atomic Emission Spectroscopy (ICP) from 1999-2003 - Ion Chromatography (2004 forward)
If flagged with '< DL' then data are below the detection limit (0.8 ueq/L). If flagged with '< RL' then data are below the reporting limit (4.1 ueq/L) and should be used with caution.

Magnesium, determined by: - Atomic Absorption Spectrophotometry (AAS) with N2O-acetylene flame (1998 and prior) - Inductively Coupled Atomic Emission Spectroscopy (ICP) from 1999-2003 - Ion Chromatography (2004 forward)
If flagged with '< DL' then data are below the detection limit (0.3 ueq/L). If flagged with '< RL' then data are below the reporting limit (1.3 ueq/L) and should be used with caution.

Potassium, determined by: - Atomic Absorption Spectrophotometry (AAS) with N2O-acetylene flame (1998 and prior) - Inductively Coupled Atomic Emission Spectroscopy (ICP) from 1999-2003 - Ion Chromatography (2004 forward)
If flagged with '< DL' then data are below the detection limit (0.4 ueq/L). If flagged with '< RL' then data are below the reporting limit (2.2 ueq/L) and should be used with caution.

textDomain.definition: If flagged with '< DL' then data are below the detection limit (0.4 ueq/L). If flagged with '< RL' then data are below the reporting limit (2.2 ueq/L) and should be used with caution.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Sodium, determined by: - Atomic Absorption Spectrophotometry (AAS) with N2O-acetylene flame (1998 and prior) - Inductively Coupled Atomic Emission Spectroscopy (ICP) from 1999-2003 - Ion Chromatography (2004 forward)
If flagged with '< DL' then data are below the detection limit (0.5 ueq/L). If flagged with '< RL' then data are below the reporting limit (2 ueq/L) and should be used with caution.

textDomain.definition: If flagged with '< DL' then data are below the detection limit (0.5 ueq/L). If flagged with '< RL' then data are below the reporting limit (2 ueq/L) and should be used with caution.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Nitrate flag: If flagged with '< DL' then data are below the detection limit (0.1 ueq/L). If flagged with '< RL' then data are below the reporting limit (1.0 ueq/L) and should be used with caution.
Nitrate, determined by ion chromatography Detection Limit: 0.1 ueq/L. Reporting Limit: 1.0 ueq/L.
Ammonium flag: If flagged with '< DL' then data are below the detection limit (0.05 mg/L). If flagged with '< RL' then data are below the reporting limit (0.1 mg/L) and should be used with caution.
Ammonium, determined by: - Autoanalyzer (2003 and prior) - Ion Chromatography (2004 forward)

Total dissolved aluminum, determined by: Atomic absorption spectroscopy with graphite furnace (1998 and prior), Inductively Coupled Plasma Optical Emission Spectroscopy (ICP-OES) 1999-2015, ICP-Mass Spectrometry (ICP-MS) from 2016

Organic aluminum, determined after filtration through exchange resin by: Atomic absorption spectroscopy with graphite furnace (1998 and prior), Inductively Coupled Plasma Optical Emission Spectroscopy (ICP-OES) 1999-2015, ICP-Mass Spectrometry (ICP-MS) from 2016

Dissolved organic carbon flag, if flagged with '< DL' then data are below the detection limit (0.1 mg/L). If flagged with '< RL' then data are below the reporting limit (0.5 mg/L) and should be used with caution.
Dissolved organic carbon, determined by infrared carbon analyzer, persulfate oxidation

Dissolved inorganic carbon flag, if flagged with '< DL' then data are below the detection limit (0.1 mg/L). If flagged with '< RL' then data are below the reporting limit (0.5 mg/L) and should be used with caution.
Dissolved organic carbon, determined by infrared carbon analyzer, persulfate oxidation

Total nitrogen flag: If flagged with '< DL' then data are below the detection limit (0.05 mg/L). If flagged with '< RL' then data are below the reporting limit (0.1 mg/L) and should be used with caution.
Total nitrogen, determined by automated colorimetry

Total phosphorus flag, if flagged with '< DL' then data are below the detection limit (0.5 ug/L). If flagged with '< RL' then data are below the reporting limit (1.0 ug/L) and should be used with caution.
Total phosphorus, determined by manual colorimetry
Silica flag: If flagged with '< DL' then data are below the detection limit (0.1mg/L). If flagged with '< RL' then data are below the reporting limit (0.5 mg/L) and should be used with caution.
Acid-neutralizing capacity, determined by Gran titration. ANC is not measured on most samples, when pH is < 5.5
Measured conductivity, determined with a Wheatstone bridge
closed cell pH, determined by electrode in sealed environment
Air-equilibrated pH, determined by electrode, with standard air (300 ppm CO2) bubbled in
Apparent color flag, If flagged with '< RL' then data are below the reporting limit (5 PCU) and should be used with caution.
Apparent color, unfiltered sample, determined by 475.5 nm spectrophotometer until 2002 and after June 2004, and by color wheel 2003-June 2004.
True color flag, If flagged with '< RL' then data are below the reporting limit (5 PCU) and should be used with caution.
True Color, determined by Hach Pt-Co color kit or Bausch & Lomb Spectronic 70 spectrophotometer
Notes when analytical holding times were exceeded or when missing values were substituted with calculated alternatives (rarely). Data users should determine applicability of data for these values.

textDomain.definition: Notes when analytical holding times were exceeded or when missing values were substituted with calculated alternatives (rarely). Data users should determine applicability of data for these values.

dataTable.entityName: Annual stream exports for East Bear and West Bear
dataTable.entityDescription: Bear Brook watershed annual stream exports for East Bear and West Bear. Units for annual data are flux units per year on a water year basis

dataTable.entityDescription: Bear Brook watershed monthly stream exports for East Bear and West Bear. Units for monthly data are flux units per month
